results.title: Station 10
results.creator_credit: Michael Scott, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a factual account of the life of policemen at one station in Montreal, drawn from sixty days and nights of on-the-spot filming. It is a view of life in the inner city that usually only the policeman has reason to encounter. There are ugly incidents here, but there is also reassurance that people in trouble do have help at hand, and that even for the law breaker the policeman does his work with impartiality, and usually with understanding and good humour. (Awards: Montreal; Melbourne.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Scott, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Stars and stripes
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An experiment in film animation in which “stars” and “stripes” perform acrobatics to the tune of the John Philip Sousa’s march. Rippling stripes and gay sparkling stars jump and undulate, dash about the screen, and break into effects suggesting a fireworks display. Sometimes part of a stripe pursues a star. Finally the stars become flashing meteors and burst in light and colour. The film was made without a camera, by Norman McLaren drawing and colouring directly on film.

results.title: Stamina
results.brief_description: A film illustrating the manufacture of Stamina trousers and showing the care exercised in all stages. The various processes are shown together with a brief history of men’s dress and the sewing machine.

results.title: St Kilda: the lonely islands
results.creator_credit: Christopher Mylne and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: An evocation of the sense of timelessness which impresses itself on a visitor to this island in the Outer Hebrides. Depicts the unique fauna, and breathtaking beauty of the place, and shows the work of conservationists on the island.
results.description: An evocation of the sense of timelessness which impresses itself on a visitor to this island in the Outer Hebrides. Depicts the unique fauna, and breathtaking beauty of the place, and shows the work of conservationists on the island.

results.title: S.S. British Sovereign
results.brief_description: Story of a British tanker from the drawing board through the shipyards to the high seas. Ship-building sequences at the Barrow-in-furnace yards in the north of England show extensive use of prefabricated methods and the film includes the launching, fitting-out and trial scenes.

results.title: The Squeeze
results.brief_description: An impressionistic study of crowding in the United States as ascertained from statistical information translated into endless rows of sprawling suburban houses, cities devouring the land, the world compressing itself into a sardine can. Voices comment on the appalling implications of an ever swelling world. Indicates the prblems which stem from over-population both in under-developed countries and in the United States.

results.title: Splash [Italian version]
results.brief_description: A home swimming pool, an accidental drowning, a distraught helpless mother. Such tragedies can be prevented. A poolside seminar demonstrates the dangers and the means of avoiding them, emphasising the need for awareness and the knowledge of basic methods of resuscitation. In Italian language only.

results.title: Spaced: the Roundhouse, London, 1969
results.creator_credit: Peter Theobald, Arts Council of Great Britain and Intergalactic Films
results.brief_description: A performance at the Roundhouse, London, by gymnasts, kendo fighters, painters, sculptors, hand balancers and acrobats, showing the structure, costumes and illustrating the use of the materials, lighting and effects.

results.title: Southern Rhodesia: climate and cultivation
results.brief_description: Shows the effect of climate and altitude on the agriculture of Southern Rhodesia. The difference between Low Veld native subsistence farming and High Veld commercial farming. Maps indicate varying altitude and seasonal rainfall which make possible the growing of maize, cotton, tobacco, fruit and barley.

results.title: South Canterbury
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and Soil Conservation and Rivers Control Council
results.brief_description: Shows problems of floods, and soil erosion in one catchment area. Explains how public authorities brought the rivers under control, and took measures for soil conservation.
